quoteFirst: In the old days, when a man died intestate, leaving no record of his debts, a creditor might establish a claim by going with the Bishop to the grave of the dead man
quoteLast: , stretching himself on it with face towards heaven and a Bible on his breast, and then saying solemnly, "I swear that So-and-so, who lies buried here, died in my debt by so much." After that the debt was allowed. What warning the Bishop first pronounced I do not know, but the scene is a vivid one, even if we think of the creditor as swearing truly, and a startling and terrible one if we think of him as about to swear to what is false.
title: The Little Manx Nation - 1891
author: Caine, Hall, Sir, 1853-1931

quoteFirst: We remained in port three days, living on the ship the while. A drive to Posilipo, the never-ending panorama of Neapolitan life, and the day at Ischia, about which I told you in my last letter, filled the time, and
quoteLast: of the third day we weighed anchor for home.
title: By the Way: Travel Letters Written During Several Journeys Abroad
